questions.direction: In the following question, select the related number from the given alternatives.

If P+Q means that P is the mother of Q, P÷Q means that P is the father of Q, and P-Q means that P is the sister of Q, then which of the following expressions shows that A is the maternal grandfather of C?
questions.question: Which expression shows A as the maternal grandfather of C?

questions.direction: Select the letter-cluster that can replace the question mark in the series.
questions.question: BD, EG, ?, JM, IQ
If 'DOG' is coded as 'WTL', how is 'CAT' coded in the same language?
Arrange the following in a logical sequence: 1. Seed, 2. Tree, 3. Fruit, 4. Flower, 5. Leaf
Select the word-pair that best represents a similar relationship to: Pen : Write :: Hammer : ?
Find the odd one out: Apple, Banana, Cherry, Date
If the day after tomorrow is Wednesday, what day is it today?

questions.direction: A # B means ‘A is the mother of B’. A @ B means ‘A is the son of B’. A & B means ‘A is the brother of B’. A % B means ‘A is the wife of B’.
questions.question: If W # Q @ T & Y @ M % K, then how is K related to W?
Which number will replace the question mark in the series: 5, 10, 17, ?, 35, 50
In a certain code, 'RUST' is written as 'VWXY'. How will 'MORN' be written?
The Finance Commission is constituted under which article of the Constitution of India?
Ashoka sent a mission to spread the principle of Dhamma led by his son, Mahendra, and daughter, Sanghamitra to which country?
Which Congress session is known for the relaxation of separate electorates for Muslims by the Congress Party?
Nalanda University was founded by which ruler?
What is the chemical formula for Quick Lime?
Which state has the least population density as per the 2011 census?
Who was the viceroy at the time of the Bengal Partition?
The theme for International Day of Yoga 2024 was:
options: B. Yoga for Self and Society
questions.answer: B. Yoga for Self and Society

questions.question: Meenakshi Temple is located in which state?
Who is known as the Father of History?
Which continent is the largest by area?
Baisakhi festival is celebrated in which month?
The 42nd Constitutional Amendment is related to:

Akshara scores 85% in five subjects together. The subjects are Hindi, Science, Mathematics, English, and Computers, where the maximum marks of each subject are 100. Akshara scores 75 marks in Hindi, 92 marks in Computers, 89 marks in Mathematics, and 81 marks in English. How many marks did Akshara score in Science?
If the diameter of a sphere is 3.5 cm, then what is the total surface area of the sphere?
If a:b = c:d, then which of the following ratios is equal to a:c?
The average mark of 60 students in a class is 62. The average marks of boys and girls in that subject are 60 and 65, respectively. The number of boys in the class is:
A train covers a distance of 600 km in 5 hours. What is its speed in km/h?
If 5x + 3y = 15 and 2x - y = 1, what is the value of x + y?
A sum of money doubles itself in 8 years at simple interest. In how many years will it triple itself?
What is the value of sin 30° + cos 60°?
A can do a work in 12 days and B in 18 days. How many days will they take to complete the work together?
If 20% of a number is 15, what is 25% of that number?
The perimeter of a rectangle is 34 cm, and its length is 10 cm. What is its breadth?
What is the HCF of 36 and 48?

questions.direction: Read the passage and answer the question that follows: The Indian economy has seen significant growth over the past few decades. Liberalization in the 1990s opened up markets, leading to increased foreign investment. However, challenges like unemployment and inflation persist. The government has introduced reforms to address these issues, but their impact is yet to be fully realized.
questions.question: What opened up markets in the Indian economy during the 1990s?
